meanings.definition: Dependent on chance or uncertain conditions.
meanings.sent1: The outdoor event was contingently planned, so we had to move it indoors when it started raining.
meanings.sent2: She found a contingently beautiful seashell while walking on the beach.
meanings.sent3: The cat's contingently playful behavior surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: His contingently lucky streak at the casino made him feel invincible.
meanings.sent5: The contingently colored leaves in the fall created a stunning landscape.

meanings.definition: Happening by chance or without planning.
meanings.sent1: The contingently timed arrival of the bus saved her from being late.
meanings.sent2: They had a contingently enjoyable time exploring the hidden cave.
meanings.sent3: The contingently matched socks made him chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her contingently chosen path led her to a hidden waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The contingently discovered treasure chest was filled with gold coins.

meanings.sent1: The contingently changing weather made it hard to plan the picnic.
meanings.sent2: His mood was contingently affected by the news he received.
meanings.sent3: The contingently shifting sands on the beach kept moving with the tide.
meanings.sent4: Her contingently altering hairstyle surprised her friends.
meanings.sent5: The contingently fluctuating stock market kept investors on edge.
